Peregrine Falcon

Did you know that the fastest animal in the planet is the Peregrine Falcon? with its diving speed of 200mph. They are three times faster than a cheetah, the fastest animal in the land!

  • Habitat: Anywhere from Artic Tundra to Tropics
  • Average Size: Body:14 to 19 in. Wingspan: 3.3 to 3.6 ft.
  • Average Lifespan: 17 years
  • Protection Status: Least Concern

Peregrine Falcons are common along the coast. They their kill prey by severing the spinal column at the neck. They have been used in falconry for 3,000 years due to their speed and are used to scare other birds to prevent bird-plane strikes improving air traffic safety.
